problem.headline: wp-cron is Unreliable and Hard to Monitor
problem.description: WordPress agencies manage critical scheduled tasks across dozens or hundreds of sites: backups, updates, cleanups, imports. When wp-cron fails silently, it's a nightmare.

pain_points.title: No Visibility
pain_points.description: Can't see which sites have failing or slow wp-cron events without logging into each one

pain_points.title: Silent Failures
pain_points.description: Backups fail, posts don't publish, imports stall—and you only find out when a client complains

pain_points.title: DISABLE_WP_CRON Complexity
pain_points.description: Real system cron is more reliable but requires manual setup on every site

pain_points.title: No SLA Reporting
pain_points.description: Agencies need uptime metrics for client reports but have no way to track wp-cron reliability

solution.headline: One Plugin. All Your Sites. Centralized Monitoring.
solution.description: Saturn Watchdog is a WordPress plugin that monitors wp-cron events and sends health data to a central dashboard. Agencies get a single pane of glass for all sites.

features.title: Automatic Discovery
features.description: Plugin discovers all active wp-cron events. No manual configuration required.

faq.question: Does it work with DISABLE_WP_CRON?
faq.answer: Yes! Works with both WordPress pseudo-cron and real system cron. The plugin detects which method you're using.

faq.question: Will this slow down my sites?
faq.answer: No. Minimal performance impact (<10ms per event). Pings are sent asynchronously after events complete.

faq.question: How do I deploy to multiple sites?
faq.answer: Install via MainWP/ManageWP bulk install, WP-CLI, or manually. Use the same org token on all sites for centralized monitoring.

faq.question: What wp-cron events are monitored?
faq.answer: All active events are auto-discovered: backups, updates, post scheduling, imports, cleanups, WooCommerce tasks, etc.

faq.question: Can I exclude certain events?
faq.answer: Yes. Configure which events to monitor per site in plugin settings.

faq.question: How much does it cost?
faq.answer: Free tier: 10 monitors (sites). Pro: $29/mo for 50 monitors. Business: $99/mo for 200 monitors. Enterprise: custom pricing.
